author: samwilsn
content: Next core devs is sure to be a rodeo: https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/583#issuecomment-1191711033

author: gcolvin
content: Unfortunately, true.  EIPs were meant to be just that -- proposals.  We have a process for reviewing them and getting them to a good Final form, but the core devs can (and do) pull them into upgrades before that, at which point the are Final, like it or not.  There should be Errata when they are found not to describe the real mainnet, but that part of the process has never much happened.    The canonical written specification remains the Yellow Paper, but it runs way behind due to inadequate resources.  Anything that behaves differently than the mainnet is wrong regardless.

author: gcolvin
content: I think that the Yellow Paper should remain and be adequately resourced, but I'm not volunteering.  And I agree that your reference implementation is a very good way of shaking out discrepancies between the EIPs, Yellow Paper, other implementations, and tests.
